title: Angular momentum conservation - angular speed afte

content.question: In the first experimental trial, the wheel is initially at rest and the clay has a mass of <math alttext="0.040 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>0.040</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math>. Just before the clay collides with and sticks to the top of the outer rim of the wheel, the clay is moving directly to the right at a speed of <math alttext="12 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>12</mtext><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mstyle></math>. After the collision, what is the angular speed of the clay-wheel system?

choices.label: <math alttext="10 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="15 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="20 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>20</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="30 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="10 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
